name: Chicken and Dressing Casserole
author: Sara Wahnsiedler Perry
summary: I got this recipe from a friend, and my whole family loves it - not to mention how easy it is to make! Note: If you wish, you can just boil 4 or 5 boneless chicken breasts instead of using a whole chicken.
ingredients: 1 (4 pound) whole chicken, deboned and cut into bite size pieces
1 (6 ounce) package herb-seasoned dry bread stuffing mix
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of celery soup
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a medium bowl combine the butter or margarine, sage and stuffing mix
Mix together and spread this mixture in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish
In the same bowl combine the cream of chicken soup, cream of celery soup and water
Mix well and pour this mixture over the chicken
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes or until bubbly
